intro: Chaetanthera scariosa, commonly known as the roughleaf chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are often covered in a rough, hairy texture, giving it its common name. Chaetanthera scariosa is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
